_description: Golden reference: per-scene entity extraction for The Mariner screenplay. Hand-curated by human + Opus 4.6 review of every action line. Used to validate scene_breakdown_v1 action-line entity extraction.
_source_script: input/2023 Round 1 Screenwriting Challenge - The Mariner - No ID.md
_notes: characters_in_action: characters introduced or mentioned in action/description lines (the target of LLM extraction)
characters_in_dialogue: characters appearing as dialogue cues (found by structural parser, included for union)
props: narratively significant objects characters interact with as tools/weapons/MacGuffins — NOT costume/wardrobe, set dressing, or incidentals
YOUNG MARINER, THUG 1, and THUG 3 never speak — they are invisible to dialogue-cue-only extraction
Scene numbering follows INT./EXT. headings as detected by the scene breakdown parser

scenes.heading: EXT. CITY CENTRE - NIGHT
scenes.notes: Establishing shot. No named entities. Generic 'homeless' and 'vigilantes' are not characters.

scenes.heading: EXT. RUDDY & GREENE BUILDING - FRONT - NIGHT
scenes.notes: Building exterior description. SUVs are set dressing.

scenes.heading: EXT. RUDDY & GREENE BUILDING - REAR - NIGHT
scenes.notes: THE MARINER first introduction (ALL CAPS in action). Most action described through sounds (O.S.). Van is a vehicle/set piece, not a hand prop.

scenes.heading: INT. RUDDY & GREEN BUILDING - ELEVATOR
scenes.notes: ROSE first visual introduction (line 42). Three THUGS introduced line 98. THUG 1 never speaks. THUG 3 never speaks. Line 110 dialogue cue 'THUG' is likely Thug 2 (muffled through doors). Mariner's costume (SWEATER, BRACERS, TATTOO, BANDOLIER, FISH HOOKS, BOOTS, CAPE, FISHING NET, WEIGHTS) is wardrobe, not props. OAR is the primary weapon. GUN belongs to Thug 1.

scenes.heading: INT. 11TH FLOOR - CONTINUOUS
scenes.notes: Rose and Mariner referenced by lowercase pronouns/names in action. FILING CABINET is set dressing. Mariner looks at his TATTOO but it's wardrobe, not a prop.

scenes.heading: EXT. COASTLINE - DAY - PAST
scenes.notes: BEGIN FLASHBACK scene. 'Young Mariner (8)' is title case, not ALL CAPS. 'his dad (30s, fisherman)' is lowercase description. Both are characters the LLM must identify from context. YOUNG MARINER never speaks in the entire screenplay.

scenes.heading: INT. STAIRWELL - CONTINUOUS
scenes.notes: Action lines use only pronouns ('She', 'he'). No entity extraction from action needed.

scenes.heading: INT. 12TH FLOOR STAIRWELL - CONTINUOUS
scenes.notes: ROSCO introduced as 'A thug (ROSCO)' — name inside parentheses, unusual pattern. GUN is Rosco's dropped weapon that Rose picks up.

scenes.heading: INT. 13TH FLOOR
scenes.notes: VINNIE, MIKEY, CARLOS introduced together (line 216). FLARE GUN described as 'a fat, bright-orange pistol' (line 256). OAR referred to as 'BLOODY OAR' (line 265). 'BOSUN' carved into the oar is a description of the OAR, not a separate prop. Line 256 has typo 'Mainer' for 'Mariner'.

scenes.heading: INT. 15TH FLOOR
scenes.notes: SALVATORI first introduction (line 352). 'Two THUGS' (line 350) are unnamed extras, not distinct characters. PURSE is the MacGuffin containing the blockchain password. OAR used to break open door. SUBMACHINE GUN is Salvatori's weapon. GUN fired into bookcase (line 403) and pointed at Rose (line 426). Room furnishings (DESK, RUG, BOOKSHELVES, BOOZE, PAINTINGS, MINTS, TUMBLER, CIGAR) are set dressing.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACKYARD - DAY - PAST
scenes.notes: BEGIN FLASHBACK. Idealized memory version. 'Young Mariner's dad' in action text. Bench press and weights mentioned but are set dressing in this idyllic version.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACKYARD - DAY
scenes.notes: Dark/true version of the backyard flashback. Dad PUNCHES Young Mariner. BENCH PRESS is actively used by Young Mariner (line 371) — qualifies as prop. RUSTY WEIGHTS and DISCARDED BOTTLES are set dressing.

scenes.heading: INT. STAIRWELL
scenes.notes: Back to present. All dialogue, no action-line entities.

scenes.heading: EXT. COASTLINE - DAY
scenes.notes: Dark/true version of the coastline flashback. Dad is drunk and neglectful. Beer bottles are incidental.

scenes.heading: EXT. BACKYARD - DAY
scenes.notes: Intercut climax. Dialogue is Salvatori/Mariner/Rose in the present overlaid on flashback scene heading. 'The thugs take Mariner's OAR' (line 401). Salvatori points GUN at Rose (line 426). Action references existing characters by lowercase names only.

prop_classification_rules: Props are objects characters physically interact with as tools, weapons, or MacGuffins
Costume/wardrobe (SWEATER, BRACERS, CAPE, etc.) is NOT a prop — separate future story
Set dressing (DESK, RUG, BOOKSHELVES, etc.) is NOT a prop
Incidentals (BOTTLE, BUTTON, DOOR) are NOT props
Descriptive text about a prop (BOSUN carved into OAR) is part of the prop, not a separate entity
